pr_title: Further tune slow broker finder sensitivity

timeline.message: Further tune slow broker finder sensitivity,.

timeline.bodyText:
It is not clear what these hardcoded magic numbers refer to or the purpose of this operation.
Can we clarify both?
timeline.author: efeg

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/cruise-control/src/test/java/com/linkedin/kafka/cruisecontrol/detector/AnomalyDetectorTestUtils.java b/cruise-control/src/test/java/com/linkedin/kafka/cruisecontrol/detector/AnomalyDetectorTestUtils.java
index 2b70a0f1..ffa61954 100644
--- a/cruise-control/src/test/java/com/linkedin/kafka/cruisecontrol/detector/AnomalyDetectorTestUtils.java
+++ b/cruise-control/src/test/java/com/linkedin/kafka/cruisecontrol/detector/AnomalyDetectorTestUtils.java

@@ -42,7 +42,8 @@ public class AnomalyDetectorTestUtils {
   /**
    * Create history load for broker.
    * @param metricValueById A set of metrics with corresponding load value.
-   * @param metricVarianceById A set of metrics with corresponding load variance.
+   * @param metricVarianceById A set of metrics with corresponding load variance. The variance here refers to the maximal
+   *                           fluctuation of metric metric value.
    * @param numWindows  Number of windows to populate.
    * @param broker The subject broker.
    * @return The load for the broker.

timeline.bodyText:
In general, using new Random() without a seed value should be avoided in unit tests.
This can lead to test failures that are not reproducible due to randomness.
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText: Are we testing with non-zero variance in any of our tests?
timeline.author: efeg

replies.bodyText: Add some variance in these test cases.
replies.author: kidkun

timeline.bodyText:
The term variance refers to the square of the standard deviation.
Does this variable refer to variance or something else?
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText: What is variance percentile? Can we rename it to better represent what it refers to?
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText: This test contains several hardcoded values, whose meanings are hard to infer. Is it possible to move them to static variables with clear names?
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.message: Piggyback a fix for topic RF anomaly.

timeline.bodyText: Nit (Also applies to fixable : above): The space before the colon should be dropped.
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText:
Nit: metric metric value -- has x2 metric.
-- Also should we refer to this as metricFluctuationById and describe what it fluctuates (i.e. it fluctuates each member of metricValueById by a uniformly distributed value in [-metricFluctuationById, metricFluctuationById])?
timeline.author: efeg

timeline.bodyText: According to the code, doesn't this value represent the half of the maximum fluctuation?
timeline.author: efeg

replies.bodyText: the real fluctuation is in range of [-metricFluctuationById, metricFluctuationById]
